title: Vermont's Ancient Secret: The Three Sisters Thrive #shorts

tasks.task: Plant the three sisters (corn, beans, and squash) using the Abenaki symbiotic planting method.
subtasks: Prepare the soil by tilling or digging to create a planting bed.
Plant corn in the center of each hill, spacing multiple kernels about 3-6 inches apart, then cover with soil.
After corn has germinated and developed a few leaves, plant beans near the corn stalks, snaking bean vines up the corn stalks as they grow.
Plant squash seeds around the perimeter of each hill, spacing them to avoid overcrowding, so their broad leaves can help suppress weeds.

tasks.task: Manage the growth and health of the three sisters.
subtasks: Regularly check for weeds and manually pull them where squash leaves aren't sufficiently shading the soil.
Monitor for pests and diseases; hand-pick any pests (like squash bugs) and apply natural remedies if necessary.
Provide water during dry periods, ensuring not to water log the soil which is important as the Abenaki method may not require extensive watering.

tasks.task: Harvest the three sisters when ripe.
subtasks: Monitor corn for yellow silk and plump kernels.
Check beans for ripe pods; harvest when pods are full and colorful.
Observe squash for hard skin and unblemished patches; harvest when the rinds are hard.

Till or dig the soil to create planting beds. Plant corn kernels 3-6 inches apart in the center (MAINTASK: Provide instructions on planting corn kernels). After corn germinates and develops a few leaves, plant beans near the corn stalks (自动将豆藤缠绕在玉米杆上) (MAINTASK: Instruct on planting beans with corn). Plant squash around the perimeter to suppress weeds (MAINTASK: Explain squash placement for weed control).

Regularly check for weeds and remove those not shaded by squash leaves (MAINTASK: Describe manual weed removal). Monitor for pests such as squash bugs and remove them by hand (MAINTASK: Instruct on handpicking pests). Water the plants only during dry periods to avoid overwatering (MAINTASK: Advise on watering the traditional Abenaki way).

Check corn for ripe silk and full kernels by observing color (MAINTASK: Describe corn harvest check). Check beans for full, colorful pods by inspection (MAINTASK: Explain bean harvesting criteria). Check squash for hard rinds and undamaged skin before harvesting (MAINTASK: Describe squash ripeness indicators).
MAINTASK: Implement the three sisters planting method by Abenaki people.
